page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: The two villages of{Harmston}and{ {Coleby}lie 6 to 8 miles S. of Lincoln in the Kesteven area of Lincolnshire. These dormitory villages are sited on Lincoln Edge,in a rural agricultural area,{Harmston}having a population of 624 and{Coleby}386.There is a large mental hospital at{Harmston.}Old stone houses with red pantile roofs, set in intricate patterns of narrow stone _ walled lanes,give the villages great charm. With their fine churches and impressive halls,they lie amongst deciduous trees on the escarpment one mile apart. Wide grass verges edge all roadways. {The Viking Way}footpath flanks the{A607}westwards along the cliff edge,whilst the Ermine Street Green Lane provides an eastern trackway.Planes from RAF Waddington's runway roar southward overhead.
